column5: I'd love your take on Ghost Narrows (aka The Volkswagon- that's what we call it.) We never catch anything of significance, but it looks amazing. PM, me if you wouldn't mind...Love to pick your brain, as it seems we fish a lot of the same areas. We'll be up the week after you.
Cool footage man. I am glad there wasnt a hook buried in your hand...
cool vid simon just watched it
ken i sent you a PM please look at

Hi all,Well....I think my expectations and excitement of walleye opener were too high, caught fish, but its been a cold spring and the fish were all over the place, some big ones deep already, but they had lockjaw, only fish feeding seemed to be in 5' to 3' FOW in the wind....LOTS OF PIKE! There was still ice on some north facing shores and average water temps were sub 50F. Still awesome to get out and fish this lake, its where I feel most at peace.VIDEOhttps://youtu.be/jhpCHEOMaW0
Boat looks great. Nice launch. Very good video in some windy conditions. Thanks for the creativity and for posting.
Thanks for sharing, the drone video is amazing!
if you need a good guide I know one.lol.
Quote: Originally Posted by NWwalleyeI KNOW 2 !!!! lolI'll pass.

Hi Limey,Long time listener, first time caller. I want to thank you for putting up Lac Seul videos for so many years. I've watched almost all your open water footage. I usually don't watch ice fishing, probably because I personally don't like it. Anyway, thanks for the early report. I will be there with my dad and brother in 2 weeks. I hope the nights stay cold and you don't go crazy with the warm days until June 6. It would be nice to hit the tail end of walleye spawn.

My brother in law from Dublin Ireland is flying over two weeks from today. Lac Seul here we come! Six beer drinkers, loads of NW Ontario fishing exp and great stories. Can't wait!! MacKenzie, Broad Lake, Ghost Narrows, Manitoba Pt, etc...... 6/9 to 6/17.
hey there where a bouts are you guys staying id like to meet the fellow from dublin
We are staying at Fishermans Cove June 10 to 17. Six guys. Two from CO, two from Iowa, one from IL and one from Dublin Ireland. All family!
